page.title: 16 CUDHAM - RECREATION GROUND
page.content: Cudham Recreation Ground is situated in the centre of the village and has been used for this purpose since 1938. The children's swings and car park have been there from the beginning and the tennis courts were added after the 2nd World War. There are 5 points of access ,one for vehicles, an enclosed children's play- ground, pavilion, tennis court, cricket square, and 2 football pitches. The rec. is owned by the London Borough of Bromley who employ two groundsmen for 35 hour per week. They keep the ground in good condition and mark out the sports pitches. The recreation ground covers an area of 10 acres with a perimeter of 802 metres. The pitches are hired by local sports clubs and also used by the village school. Cricket on the "village green" is a popular summer attraction.
